Russia: Polish–Russian War (1609–1618): The Truce of Deulino ended the war. Muscovy ceded the city of Smolensk and the Czernihów Voivodeship to Poland.
Poland: Signing of the Truce of Deulino concludes the Polish–Muscovite War
Philippine: Alonso Fajardo de Entenza appointed Governor-General (1618–1624).
Lebanon: Fakhr ad-Din II returns to Lebanon with the beginning of Muhammad Pasha's reign as the new governor of Damascus.
Germany: Thirty Years' War: A war began which would cause massive devastation and loss of life, primarily in Germany.
Cambodia: Suriyopear abdicates, enters a monastery (dies next year). His son Chey Chettha II becomes king.
Belgium: Opening of Mount of piety (low-interest loan bank) in Brussels, founded by Wenceslas Cobergher.
Australia: VOC ship Mauritius under command of Supercargo Willem Janszoon, landed near North West Cape, and named Willem's River, later renamed Ashburton River.
